text:
Hello, I have the last versions of Apache, PHP and MySql installed on Windows 
2000 advanced server (without IIS surly)

about 10 times aday the server restarts and sometimes when there is no activity 
at all!
Google is filled with the phrase : "child process exited with status 
3221225477". many belive that it has to do with PHP but when the server is on 0 
activity, PHP can not come into action!
So, I belive that there is a small memory-leak somewhere :(

This is the cutout of the restarting error notification when Apache restarts:
There are no errors before and no errors after the restarting.


[Fri Dec 23 10:43:42 2005] [notice] Parent: child process exited with status 
3221225477 -- Restarting.
[Fri Dec 23 10:43:42 2005] [notice] Apache configured -- resuming normal 
operations
[Fri Dec 23 10:43:42 2005] [notice] Server built: Oct  9 2005 19:16:56
[Fri Dec 23 10:43:42 2005] [notice] Parent: Created child process 752
[Fri Dec 23 10:43:43 2005] [notice] Child 752: Child process is running
[Fri Dec 23 10:43:43 2005] [notice] Child 752: Acquired the start mutex.
[Fri Dec 23 10:43:43 2005] [notice] Child 752: Starting 64 worker threads.
creator: sambukkaa@hotmail.com

text:
Yes we have EXACTLY THE SAME PROBLEM!!!!!! And would like to die!!!!  We are
about to release a new platform and this:

Parent: child process exited with status 3221225477 -- Restarting.

HELP!!!!!

Windows 2000 - Apache 2.0.55 - php 5.1.1 and MySQL 5.0
creator: gary.wilson@coull.biz
jorton@redhat.com
text:
This is a "something crashed" report -- unless you can get a backtrace out of
the crash it is impossible for anybody to track this down further.
